channel.title: Developers
channel.description:
So right now we have how many people are developing moparclassic?
CodeForFame Object (If he has the free time) .. .. ..
The source as it is with the 3-4 bug fixes is stable and can handle the player load of the community. The question is.. what exactly is stopping us? I also suggest having someone else having the ability to accept pull requests.

item.title: Developers
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

sure, MITB or Lothy can give CCF commit access.

Read full topic

item.title: Developers
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

On a related note, since CodeForFame seems to be doing a lot of work on the server, is there any reason he shouldn't be able to directly commit?

Exactly what we have been saying ofc he should.

Read full topic

item.title: Developers
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Yes, I’m just waiting on CodeForFame to up the client to run in moparscape somewhere so I can have a look. Server-wise I don’t know what else needs done, someone else will have to comment on that.

On a related note, since CodeForFame seems to be doing a lot of work on the server, is there any reason he shouldn’t be able to directly commit?

Read full topic

item.title: Developers
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Well, the client needs to run inside the MoparScape client.

Once that’s done I think we’re good.

Read full topic
